message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.MM, cs.GR, cs.IT

This paper involves the development of an optical probe-based system for intra-operative measurements of tissue shape and multi/hyperspectral information. The system uses structured lighting and white light imaging to provide quasi-dense surface shape reconstruction in real-time. Additionally, the paper reports the realization of "super-spectral-resolution" by integrating RGB images and sparse hyperspectral data using convolutional neural networks. Given these technical details, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is computer vision (cs.CV), followed by robotics (cs.RO) and multimedia (cs.MM). Graphics (cs.GR) and information theory (cs.IT) are also possible sub-categories, as the paper involves the development of an imaging system and the use of neural networks for data processing.
